triples.evidence: The impacts of the intervals between P&E operations on 3D TLC NAND flash are investigated under room temperature and high temperature.
The tester can support a maximum data transfer of ~200 MHz and a wide temperature range for operations, from 25°C (room temperature, RT) to 85°C (high temperature, HT).
The tester can support a maximum data transfer of ~200 MHz and a wide temperature range for operations, from 25°C (room temperature, RT) to 85°C (high temperature, HT).
Three-dimensional charge-trapping (CT) NAND flash memory has attracted extensive attention owing to its unique merits, including huge storage capacities, large memory densities, and low bit cost.
To improve the memory reliability of 3D CT TLC NAND, different intervals between P&E operations should be adopted considering the operating temperatures.

mappings.label: Temperature
mappings.notes: Temperature is directly mentioned in the context of environmental factors.

mappings.label: TLC
mappings.notes: TLC is explicitly mentioned as the cell type of the NAND flash.

mappings.label: Reliability
mappings.notes: Reliability is a key focus of the paper, directly impacting SSD performance.
